subject: Cybersecurity
title: Intrusion Prevention Systems: Blocking Attacks in Real Time
description: A short lesson to help you apply Intrusion Prevention Systems: Blocking Attacks in Real Time.

hook.text: While firewalls guard the door, intrusion prevention systems patrol every room looking for suspicious behavior.

buildup.text: An IPS analyzes network traffic in real time, comparing patterns against known attack signatures and anomalies.

discovery.text: When an IPS detects an attack, it doesn't just alert â€“ it automatically blocks the malicious traffic before it.

twist.text: False positives are the enemy: block legitimate traffic and you disrupt business. Too many false alarms and.

climax.text: An IPS must balance sensitivity and specificity. Too aggressive blocks work; too passive misses attacks.

punchline.text: The hardest part isn't stopping attacks. It's not stopping everything else.

quiz.question: What is the biggest challenge for Intrusion Prevention Systems?
options: Balancing false positives (blocking legitimate traffic) with detecting real attacks
